description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) because it directly injects user-controlled data into the HTML document without proper sanitization or output encoding, which allows an attacker to inject malicious scripts. Also, the function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) because it does not validate or verify the origin of the request, allowing an attacker to trick a victim into executing unwanted actions on a web application in which they're authenticated.
